def: Having the property of crystallizing by the agency of fire.
The sliding crosspiece, or vane, on a leveling staff.
The secretion from the salivary glands.

A prefix signifying in or into, used in many English words,chiefly those borrowed from the French. Some English words arewritten indifferently with en- or in-. For ease of pronunciation itis commonly changed to em- before p, b, and m, as in employ, embody,emmew. It is sometimes used to give a causal force, as in enable,enfeeble, to cause to be, or to make, able, or feeble; and sometimesmerely gives an intensive force, as in enchasten. See In-.
The act of disfurnishing, or the state of being disfurnished.[Obs.]
A hound for baiting or hunting bears. Car
A lining of planks or boards (rarely of metal) for protectingan embankment.
Capable of being procured; obtainable. Boyle.
The day on which the President of the United States isinaugurated, the 4th of March in every year next after a yeardivisible by four.
An acetabulum; or about one eighth of a pint. [Obs.] Holland.
A case or holder made of fire clay, in which fine pottery isinclosed while baking in the kin. [Written also saggar, sagger, andsegger.] Ure.
